title: Manage Biodiversity and Land Clearing
description: Before clearing land for a new waste dump, an environmental officer surveys the area for protected species.

tasks.description: Review the planned land clearing area on a map.
tasks.expected_outcome: The area to be cleared is identified.

tasks.description: Conduct a field survey of the area to identify any protected flora or fauna.
tasks.expected_outcome: The survey identifies a population of a protected orchid species within the clearing footprint.

tasks.description: Develop a plan to translocate the protected orchids to a suitable, safe habitat before clearing begins.
tasks.expected_outcome: A species management plan is created and approved, allowing the project to proceed while protecting biodiversity.
